FuncDef: The display interface (port extend) command displays information about a port extension interface on a master.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of an interface whose information is to be displayed.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the type and number of an interface whose information is to be displayed.
The value is a string of 1 to 63 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Examples: Route Port,The Maximum Transmit Unit is 1500
IP Sending Frames' Format is PKTFMT_ETHNT_2, Hardware address is 00e0-fc12-3456
Last 300 seconds input rate: 0 bits/sec, 0 packets/sec
Last 300 seconds output rate: 0 bits/sec, 0 packets/sec
Input peak rate 0 bits/sec, Record time: -
Output peak rate 0 bits/sec, Record time: -
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In port extension scenarios, to check information about a port extension interface (including port extension trunk interface) on a master, run the display interface remote command.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
Before running the display interface remote command, you are advised to run the reset counters interface remote command to clear the existing statistics on the specified interface.
